alert.note: Alert for Adair; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:16PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Crawford, southwestern Washington, northeastern Sequoyah and southeastern Adair Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Brushy, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Winslow... Brushy... Devils Den State Park... Strickler... Blackburn... Lee Creek... Short... Uniontown... Hogeye... Odell... Mount Gayler... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 36 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and east central Oklahoma.
